title: These loose ends ought to be matters of plot; in fact, or so I argue, the Wife makes them matters of primarily thematic concern. She applies a similar tactic throughout her Tale, where plot, turning upon the knight’s quest and the heroine’s actual and potential responses to him, likewise becomes the principal element of theme. Even more obviously, she often narrates the might-have-beens of her life with the three old husbands as specifically not “plot”
